Ryon & Victoria

Tyesha

Is Ryon’s youngest sister and a beloved friend (and soon-to-be sister in-law) of the bride. Tyesha and Victoria bonded over their long phone conversations about school and life, and their mutual love of Beyoncé. Victoria is brimming with excitement to have Tyesha as her sister.

Aniya

Is Ryon’s eldest sister and a beloved friend (and soon-to-be- sister in-law) of the bride. Aniya has been a big supporter of Ryon and Victoria, and lured Victoria into the family by making Victoria’s favorite Mac and Cheese at family holidays. Victoria anxiously awaits the day she can share life with Aniya as her sister.

Ebony

Is Victoria’s Matron of Honor and one of her closest friends. Ebony was introduced to Victoria by Denise in college, and they became fast friends because of their mutual love for food and trap music. You can catch ebony and Victoria having random breakfasts at IHOP at all hours of the day or night, or shopping at their local mall.

Ashley

Ashely is Victoria’s friend and former college roommate. Victoria and Ashley lived together unofficially in undergrad when Victoria would constantly stay at her cousin Denise’s apartment during the summer (Ashley and Denise were roommates at the time.) Eventually, Ashley and Victoria got an apartment together and spent a year doing brunch and bickering over whose turn it was to kill the spiders.

Chanel

Has been Victoria’s partner in crime since middle school. Chanel and Victoria have fond memories of meeting up in Florida for the summer (where their extended family lived) and ditching high school to go to Sea World. Despite living in different states the past few years, Chanel and Victoria often get together over the phone to laugh and discuss politics.

Ariel

Is one of the bride’s oldest friends. Victoria and Ariel attended San Diego Academy together from Kindergarten to the ninth grade. Ariel was not fond of Victoria when they met on their first day in kindergarten because Victoria had a runny nose and wouldn’t stop sniffling. Fast forward 25 years and Victoria and Ariel are close as family, who would have thought!

Alonzo

One of Ryon’s closest friends and the best man. Ryon and Alonzo met their freshman year of college. They instantly connected through their shared love of sports and technology and continued to bond through late night Call of Duty sessions. While separated by distance, Alonzo and Ryon try to take an annual vacation to commemorate their friendship and catch up on what they’ve been missing.

Aman

One of Ryon’s closest friends since childhood. Aman and Ryon met in middle school and have been inseparable since. Aman was a driving force in connecting Ryon to two of his passions – Halo and track. When they aren’t reminiscing on their adolescence shenanigans, Aman and Ryon can be seen at Adolfo’s, planning their night.

Chris

One of Ryon’s closest friends since middle school. Chris and Ryon grew up across the street from each other and would often spend time getting beat in Goldeneye 007 by some of the neighborhood kids. Chris would always make sure that Ryon would have a good time going out and experiencing new things, as Ryon was always more of an introvert. When time permits, Chris and Ryon like to reconnect over a drink and a sporting event, or even a lowkey Netflix night at the house.

Clyde

One of Ryon’s closest friends since college. Clyde and Ryon met their freshman year in college, and immediately hit it off over their joint love of computers, video games, and anime. As time went on, it would be rare to see them apart. Clyde and Ryon spent much time together hanging out in the off-campus dorms, chilling and planning out the weekend. These days, Clyde and Ryon can often be seen at Kabuki, catching up on each other’s lives over teriyaki chicken and sake.

Jonathan

Ryon’s nephew. Since he was a kid, Ryon would enjoy joking around with Jonathan, such as telling him the tale of “El Charro.” As the time has flown by, Jonathan and Ryon would spend time playing NBA 2K, and debating why Kobe is a better player than LeBron. Now in college, Ryon couldn’t be prouder of Jonathan. Ryon and Jonathan spend time catching up over dinner and discussing the latest episode of Dragon Ball Super.

Leo

A close friend of Ryon’s since college. Leo and Ryon met in an engineering club and have been friends since. Leo and Ryon bonded over their mutual love for baseball, and interest in technology and politics. In what has become a tradition for the duo, Leo and Ryon can often be seen at “the Block” to grab a drink and catch up on each other’s daily lives.

Mike

One of Ryon’s close childhood friends. They met in elementary, both joined the cross country team and even attended the same college and have remained tight since. Mike and Ryon would often hang out at the Irvine Spectrum and discuss new developments in their lives. These days, Mike and Ryon like to catch up over a pint and see how each other’s careers are progressing.

Thank you for visiting

We hope to see you soon!
